The divorce left him deeply depressed.
I was depressed at the thought of all the hard work ahead.
suffering from a medical condition in which you are so unhappy that you cannot live a normal life
an area, industry etc that is depressed does not have enough economic or business activity
a depressed level or amount is lower than normal
depressed.translation[0].note_box[0].sec: The boy said he was unhappy at school and felt depressed.
If you get depressed, talk to someone about it.
Is Jo all right? She sounded a bit depressed.
He became severely depressed after losing his job.
I could see that she was deeply depressed.
He was exhausted and mildly depressed.
I felt a bit depressed because I was so short of money.
His medical records show that he was suicidal and clinically depressed.
an economy or industry that is depressed does not have enough manufacturing or business activity
The Swiss drug company was a major winner in an otherwise depressed sector as its yearly results provided welcome comfort for investors.
help for companies suffering from the depressed economic climate
if the price of something is depressed, it is lower than normal
The timber was sold, albeit at prices depressed by the glut of timber on the market.
